intro: Stisseria maculosa, commonly known as the spotted stisseria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped with a rough texture and may have a slight pubescence. Stisseria maculosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
